Key:
(Maria's transfer made for a busy morning, but
now that everyone's getting used to her being
around, the class is progressing as normal.)
Hrrm...
Hm...

(However, I've caught both Tohka and Origami
glaring at me from time to time. My desk is so
close to theirs. Scary, but I'm used to it.)

Hey, Shido-san. Are you as bored as I am?
If you'd like, it might be more fun to leave
those two and go someplace else.

(From behind me, I hear a voice of temptation.
Ignore it. Just focus.)

(Even still, with the situation being a little
stranger than usual, class is going on as it
usually did.)
(I wonder what Maria's up to...)

(She's not taking notes. She's just staring at
the chalkboard, her posture is upright. I'm sure
she's paying attention, but she sticks out.)

Sooo, then. Is there anyone who could tell us the
answer for this problem?

(Tama-chan stood at the podium, trying to
hold her students' interest, but the class was
silent. No one raised their hand to answer.)

(Except for... Ohh? Maria raised her hand.
Maybe she couldn't bother to keep silent?)
Oh, Arusu-san. Do you know the answer?

(Maria shot up from her seat. It seems she
did.)
Before I answer, I have a question.
Y-Yes? What would that be?!

This textbook contains poorly-written prose
with awful grammar. It intentionally obscures
the content. How are we to learn from this?
Huuuh?!

(Hey now. Questioning the actual textbook...
I don't think the teacher's ever seen that
before.)
Ah, um...

(I'm sure there's truth to what she said, but
this is... Man, I almost feel bad for her.)
Hey, Maria... Maria!
...? Oh, of course.

(Hm? When I called to her, she reacted,
almost like in realization.)

Teacher, I apologize. My point was irrelevant
to your lesson. It was wrong of me to bring it up.
I will endeavor to study more.

U-Uhhh...? I-It's fine.
You can go at your own pace, Arusu-san.
Thank you. I will be careful from now on.
(Whew, seems like it worked out.)
...Hee hee.

(My eyes met with Maria's. She had a faint
smile.)
